meanings.definition: A person who uses irony in their speech or writing.
meanings.sent1: The group of ironists at the comedy club always made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: Many famous authors are known as ironists for their clever use of irony.
meanings.sent3: The ironists in the play had the audience chuckling at their witty remarks.
meanings.sent4: She was a true ironist, weaving sarcasm into every sentence she spoke.
meanings.sent5: The classroom was filled with young ironists who loved to play with words and meanings.

meanings.sent1: In the library, I found a book about famous ironists throughout history.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed portraits of ironists from different time periods.
meanings.sent3: The ironists in the room all had unique perspectives on the world.
meanings.sent4: The gathering of ironists was a sight to behold, each with their own style.
meanings.sent5: The conference brought together ironists from around the world to share their insights.
